speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: That many of you here tonight came home not to a hero's welcome but to the hostility of the American people is a shameful fact of history. One that I will never understand or forgive. But it also underscores our sacred duty, not just today but forever, to honor those who served with honor and to remember those who fell, men and women whose ultimate sacrifice must never be forgotten. There is probably no audience that understands better that our freedom is not free...

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right, you're my eyes out there. Talk to me. Positions report.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: We owe that freedom to the selfless sacrifice of those...

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: Sector three clear.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No sign of him in four.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Sector six, report. Mulder?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... it is our duty to remember them...

speaker: MULDER
line: He's here. I feel him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then where is he?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... This country was born on the backs of people willing to fight for their freedom...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hold on. I think I have him in section four.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can you confirm that, Scully?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... and for that, I think it would be an investment that they would be proud of today...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Positive ID. He's heading toward you, three.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Positions hold. Three and four, do you have eye contact?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... There is a statue of a solider and the plaque on that statue reads "not for themselves but for their country"...

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: I have him in three. He's coming to you, Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't take your eyes off him, Scully.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... That attitude has perservered as the spirit of American soldiers, and it is in this spirit that we honor our contrymen...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he saw me. He's heading towards the sound booth.

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: Copy that. I'm cutting him off.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Talk to me, people. Does anybody have him? What's happening, Scully?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... This memorial is a place where we can come and thank those men and women who died not for themselves but for their country...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm closing on him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do you have him in three?

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: Negative.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... I'm always struck by something as I walk this mall. The Vietnam Memorial...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully? Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I lost him. You got him, three?

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: I don't see him, Scully?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... always someone standing at it, always someone running their fingers across the names...

speaker: SKINNER
line: What's happening, Agent Scully?

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: I can't see him anywhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He must be headed your way. You got him, Mulder?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... There's a tremendous amount of emotion in that simple act.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not yet. I got him. I lost him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Pick him up, Mulder. He's right in front of you.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's got a gun!

speaker: SKINNER
line: General, get off the stage!

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't see him. I can't see him.

speaker: SOLDIER 1
line: Morning, Sir!

speaker: SOLIDER 2
line: All right. Let's go!

speaker: GEN. MACDOUGAL
line: Who the hell are you? How did you get in here? What the hell are you...

speaker: PFC BURKHOLDER
line: Lieutenant General, Sir!

speaker: FBI HEADQUARTERS, NOVEMBER 12, 7
line: 18 AM

speaker: SKINNER
line: Lieutenant General Peter MacDougal was shot dead at extreme close range at 0600 this morning. FBI Forensics reports the wound was not self-inflicted. The murder weapon has not been recovered. The general's driver, Private First Class Gus Burkholder, is currently being held on suspicion of murder.

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: Well, it says here NAA tests confirm the private did not do the shooting.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There is suspicion of an accomplice, based on the one piece of evidence found at the crime scene, a so-called "death card" used by soldiers in Vietnam to mark their kills and by Private Burkholder's possible ties to a radical paramilitary group called The Right Hand, whose stated aim is violent revolution. After speaking with General Bloch he believes we have a high probability of opportunity for a group like this, a unique situation that can result in the very public loss of lives. Dozens of high-ranking military officials are in Washington today for rededication of the Vietnam Veterans War Memorial. Unless we can determine a clear motive, we will consider any one of them to be a target.

speaker: MULDER
line: What if Private Burkholder's telling the truth, that he's innocent?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Until we can find another suspect, the FBI will pursue The Right Hand and their leader, an ex-marine named Denny Markham, in a preemptive strategy to put a stop to any other plans that he might have made. Now you all have Markham's file in front of you. For obvious reasons, our strategy includes keeping this from the media. You'll be working in teams of two. If you encounter any resistance, do not engage - surveil and call for backup. Agent Chandler has your assignments and your field warrants. We have less than 12 hours to prevent any further execution or loss of life. Understood?

speaker: AGENT CHANDLER
line: All right, Beckwith and Fontana, you're going to Virginia Beach. Jackson and Miller, you're going to Alexandria.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Was that for the benefit of the general, or have you been able to develop a real strategy?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Right now, I'm flying by the seat of my pants.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mean there's no procedure outlined for an invisible assasin?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Did you talk to Private Burkholder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I interviewed him and convinced him to take a polygraph test.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And?

speaker: MULDER
line: He passed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The nature of his claims would suggest a false positive. The tester admitted that the results are hightly interpretive.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You heard his story, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. I found his story compelling, personally, but then again I believe the Warren Commission.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, if I have to devise a strategy around that story, then there is no strategy. Somebody killed the general, which means somebody is not telling the truth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The man who heads The Right Hand - Markham. Do you have a warrant for him?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let Mulder and I serve it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: One misstep... Markham smells a shakedown, he's gonna disappear and find another way to push the button. And I've already seen more dead soldiers than I ever want to see.

speaker: DEMETER, VIRGINIA, 8
line: 48 AM

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Markham?

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Who is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agents Mulder and Scully with the FBI.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: What do you want?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's extremely urgent that we talk to you right now, sir.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Markham?

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Gate's unlocked.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Now, you wanted to see me about...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The murder of General Peter MacDougal.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Am I under suspicion?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, but your group is. And Private First Class Gus Burkholder.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Is that a name I should know?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's on the mailing list for The Right Hand.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Two thousand names on that list. I can't keep track of every one of them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we'd like to go over that list with you, sir.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: No way in hell you'll be getting that from me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We already have a copy, if you'll just come with us.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: I'm not going anywhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, we have a warrant for your arrest if you don't cooperate. Under the new anti-terrorism law, we can and will hold you until we get the information we want.

speaker: MULDER
line: There goes the neighborhood.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You can make this as easy or as hard as you wish, sir.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: The Right Hand believes in empowering the individual over a corrupt and corrupting federal government. We're prepared for the time when armed resistance will be necessary. Lives will have to be sacrificed, but that day has not yet come.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would you take a polygraph, Mr. Markham?

speaker: MARKHAM
line: My word's good enough.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's your "word" on this?

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Where'd that come from?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd like to ask you that.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: More men are gonna die.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This guy's a one-man threat to national security. I bet he's got more weapons and ammo than most third-world armies.

speaker: MULDER
line: He told me to pull this photo from his file cabinet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who's this?

speaker: MULDER
line: He says that's who killed General MacDougal.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Name's Nathaniel Teager. 26 confirmed solo enemy kills. A veritable killing machine. Left for dead by the same government that created him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Left for dead?

speaker: MARKHAM
line: He belonged to Green Beret detachment B-11 - The squad known as the "Bloody Sabers." In 1971, the B-11 was being transported in country when their chopper was shot down. There were no survivors.

speaker: MULDER
line: When was this photo taken?

speaker: MARKHAM
line: December 1995. Just a few hours after The Right Hand liberated him from a POW camp just outside the U-Minh forest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Markham, I'm sure that you're aware that in 1973 the Defense Department determined that there were no more POW's in Vietnam.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Maybe that's why they tried to kidnap Sergeant Teager when we brought him home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The government kidnapped a US prisoner of war?

speaker: MARKHAM
line: I said they tried... had their commandoes board our plane in San Diego. When they broke into the cargo hold where we hid him, he was already gone. I never did figure out how.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I've heard enough.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't believe him, do you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what if he's telling the truth?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A phantom POW left for dead comes back to avenge the injustices?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe the war ain't over, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or maybe not Denny Markham's war.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, given the facts of the case and Private Burkholder's polygraph test, this is the closest thing to an explanation that we've got.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or it's just a clever story being proffered as a cover-up for what is actually an elaborately orchestrated conspiracy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, there is that possibility, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let Markham take the polygraph.

speaker: MULDER
line: What if he passes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He won't.

speaker: TEAGER
line: Mrs. Davenport. Renee Davenport?

speaker: RENEE DAVENPORT
line: Yes.

speaker: TEAGER
line: Wife of Lance Corporal Gary Davenport of the Special Forces?

speaker: RENEE DAVENPORT
line: Yes. I'm sorry, do I know you?

speaker: TEAGER
line: No, ma'am. I've come to act in his behalf for the reason that Gary remains a prisoner of war.

speaker: RENEE DAVENPORT
line: Gary's dead.

speaker: TEAGER
line: No, ma'am. May you forgive me as you forgive him, as a man and as a soldier, for restoring the honor and the memory of the B-11.

speaker: RENEE DAVENPORT
line: Oh my God! Where did you get these? Who gave you these?

speaker: RENEE DAVENPORT
line: Hey, where are you? Tell me, where are you? Where'd you go?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it true she made a positive ID from the photo?

speaker: SKINNER
line: From a bad fax of it. Do you have the actual photo with you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, and more copies to distribute.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We have event security checking out all vendors and workmen. We've got it out to local law enforcement, but not to the exclusion of the other suspects.

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought she ID'd Teager?

speaker: SKINNER
line: She did, but I cannot authorize or promote a strategy here that's gonna target a soldier who's officially dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Because his name's on the wall?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, because I just got off the phone with the Army Forensics Lab, where Sgt. Nathaniel Teager's remains have been stored since they were recovered from the crash site.

speaker: MULDER
line: They have his remains?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Markham may have staged this whole thing, finding somebody vulnerable like her to pass off his lies.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why go to all that trouble?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To create a decoy, to divert our attention. It seems to be working.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, this woman saw someone. I want to know who.

speaker: RENEE DAVENPORT
line: Yes, that's him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you sure?

speaker: RENEE DAVENPORT
line: Everything he said made it sound like Gary was still alive. That can't be true. Can it?

speaker: MULDER
line: You say he just disappeared?

speaker: RENEE DAVENPORT
line: That's what's so strange. One minute he's standing right in front of me, and then he's gone. What if he's telling the truth? What if Gary is alive? I've tried to get on with my life. I've remarried. What am I supposed to tell my husband now? What am I supposed to do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, your eye.

speaker: RENEE DAVENPORT
line: What? Oh, my God! What's happening to me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you just burst a capillary.

speaker: RENEE DAVENPORT
line: Oh my God!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hold a tissue there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can we give Mrs. Davenport an eye exam?

speaker: SCULLY
line: An eye exam? For what?

speaker: MULDER
line: By all accounts, the man we're looking for - the man she saw - has a knack for vanishing in plain sight. Maybe there's a connection.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what she has is a simple sub-conjunctival hemorrhage. It's probably brought on by her emotional state.

speaker: MULDER
line: And how did she reach that emotional state?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about you? What are you gonna do?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm gonna see if we're really chasing a dead man.

speaker: ARMY CENTRAL IDENTIFICATION LAB, 1
line: 22 PM

speaker: DR. KEYSER
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: DR. KEYSER
line: Dr. Benjamin Keyser. I think I located what you're looking for. It's a small miracle I found it, actually. The record had been partially destroyed.

speaker: DR. KEYSER
line: Two bicuspids and a molar.

speaker: MULDER
line: This was all that was left of Teager at the crash site?

speaker: DR. KEYSER
line: Well, I've seen findings made with far less. And these are Sgt. Teager's teeth. I cross-checked them with his dental records.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there any way to tell how the teeth were extracted?

speaker: DR. KEYSER
line: Well, I would assume that they were pulled. On each of these teeth, there's a pronounced scoring in the enamel. See for yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you tell if that was pre- or post-mortem?

speaker: DR. KEYSER
line: No, not really.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well then this is presumptive, isn't it? A finding of death based on inconclusive evidence?

speaker: DR. KEYSER
line: Well, actually it was noted right here, even underlined. "Inconclusive."

speaker: MULDER
line: Whoever signed off on this death chose to ignore the facts, huh?

speaker: DR. KEYSER
line: I couldn't tell you who that was. As I said to you, these records were partially destroyed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there any other way to tell?

speaker: DR. KEYSER
line: Well, based on the records and the reports filed at the same time, we can make a pretty good guess.

speaker: DRIVER
line: Yes. Yes, just a moment. It's for you, sir.

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: Hello.

speaker: MULDER
line: General Steffan, this is Special Agent Fox Mulder with the FBI. I'm calling because we have reason to believe that your life may be in danger.

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: That the person or persons responsible for the murder of General MacDougal this morning may have chosen to target you.

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: Based on what information?

speaker: MULDER
line: Based on a death certificate that you may have put your signature on. A death certificate for Sgt. Nathaniel Teager.

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: I don't know anything about that, but I'm on my way to the Pentagon right now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Listen, sir, I'm ten minutes away. I gonna have to ask you to trust my risk assessment on this and take every caution.

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: Right.

speaker: MULDER
line: OK, do you know your driver, sir?

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: Yes. He drives me all the time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good. I'm gonna put two FBI agents there to escort you just as a precaution. They have my mobile phone number, OK?

speaker: PRIVATE
line: How many of you know what a pentagon is? A pentagon is a shape of five sides, and the Pentagon is just that. We're standing right now in Section A, built in 1941 through an act of Congress, the Pentagon is virtually a city in itself. Almost 23,000 people...

speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
line: General, sir.

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: Good afternoon.

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: All clear, General.

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: Thank you, gentlemen. That will be all.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I'm at a Georgetown medical center.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you find out what caused her eye to hemorrhage?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, but the opthamologist discovered something. Something called a transient scotoma.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scotoma?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A floating blind spot.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what would cause that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, any number of diseases can scar the retina. Diabetes, glaucoma, macular degeneration. In turn, they, they create a visual field deficit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, does she have any of those diseases?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It doesn't appear so.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, don't you think it's odd, Scully, that she'd have a blind spot that she wouldn't, uh, that she wouldn't have noticed before? Thanks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, not necessarily. Uh, the processes of the brain fill in and the visual cortex compensates conceptually.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that might account for Teager's vanishing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I asked the doctor that, and he laughed at me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, hold on second, Scully. It's Mulder.

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: Agent Mulder, this is General Steffan. I found something on my desk... something very troubling.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are you?

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: In my office.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right. The agents that I assigned to you - are they with you?

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: No, no, they're just outside.

speaker: MULDER
line: I want you to call them into your office right now, General.

speaker: GEN. STEFFAN
line: Who put this here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Listen to me very carefully, OK? I'm on my way over there.

speaker: MULDER
line: General Steffan? General Steffan?

speaker: MULDER
line: Call an ambulance.

speaker: MULDER
line: The general's secretary had been in here organizing his desk no more than fifteen minutes before the general was shot. He never saw this card and he never saw anyone go in and out of the office aside from the general and the agents assigned to him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, from my cursory exam, nothing about the general can explain your narrative.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was on the phone with the man. He was shot at close range in the forehead. I think he would have seen the shooter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not necessarily. He could have turned and been surprised. There's far too little forensic evidence yet to know, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: No scotoma?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's beyond my capabilities here to make that kind of analysis.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think it's beyond all our capabilities, but somebody's got to explain how a four-star general could be shot and killed in what is symbolically the best guarded military base in the country.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I need both of you out here to see something. Now.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's him. That's Teager.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Whoever it is, I want to know how the hell this happened.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Neither of us has a clear explanation, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You were on your way here, Agent Mulder. You knew the general was in danger.

speaker: MULDER
line: I did everything I could. I put two agents with him...

speaker: SKINNER
line: This is insanity. This man is killing at will.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's correct, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, he's unstoppable, is that what you're telling me?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think that Teager has an ability - the ability to effectively erase himself from the visual field.

speaker: SKINNER
line: If he's invisible, then why is he on this video, clear as day?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think he can hide himself from human sight by manipulating something that Scully has referred to as naturally occurring, a blind spot.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That is conjecture, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You mean even if I'm looking at him...

speaker: MULDER
line: You might not be able to see him. Isn't it true that American soldiers have reported the unexplained appearance and disappearance of V.C. guerrillas? I've read the dispatches myself. I mean, maybe Teager learned something from his captors in 25 years of isolation.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've got 4 miles of crowded streets where 31 military officers are staging for a parade into Freedom Square. If what you're saying has any truth to it, I can't protect these men.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Call it off.

speaker: MULDER
line: Parade or no parade, those men are gonna be vulnerable. The only way to stop this killer is to catch him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How do we do that?

speaker: MULDER
line: By finding his next victim before he does.

speaker: FORT EVANSTON, MARYLAND, 4
line: 08 PM .

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: I'm Major General Benjamin Bloch.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: He did it again, didn't he? I told him he would.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: According to the FBI, you know the man they're looking for. Maybe you can tell me why they can't seem to find him.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: The same reason you can't. Which I imagine is the same reason you're here right now.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: I am here because people are dying... soldiers who dedicated their lives to the defense of this country.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: I guess that's one way of looking at it.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: As it stands, you are facing charges of conspiracy to commit homicide and treason. But if both those fall through, there is still enough evidence to convict you for possession and transport of illegal arms.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Are you threatening me?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: No. I am offering you a deal... for you and the people you represent.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: If you think I've got any sway with Teager, you're mistaken.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: I just need to know what he wants.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: You know what he wants. And we both know you can't give it to him. Not without dragging that nice, clean uniform of yours through the mud.

speaker: MARKHAM
line: Whatever you do to me won't change his mind, General. He's sending a message and making damn sure everyone hears it loud and clear.

speaker: BAND LEADER
line: Men! Mark time!

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: You told me you were in a rush.

speaker: MULDER
line: Cross-town traffic's all snarled up because of the parade.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: You need information on American prisoners of war?

speaker: MULDER
line: A man named Teager.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: I have no information on him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then why did you come here?

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Tell me what you know.

speaker: MULDER
line: A POW named Teager may be back home carrying out death sentences against the men that left him in Vietnam.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Who are those men?

speaker: MULDER
line: Generals - Steffan and MacDougal.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: They have a connection.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is that?

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: A recent news story, extremely embarrassing to the US military, about the disposing of South Vietnamese soldiers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Men employed by our government as spies and commandos and then left behind enemy lines to certain capture and death. The operation was disavowed and their lives were erased from the records.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: By a secret three-man commission who may now be facing charges. Whose testimonies might be used in the calculation of reparations.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you saying that our government wants these officers dead? Why would they ask us to protect them?

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Because they know you can't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, who's the third man? I need a name.

speaker: SCULLY
line: General Bloch?

speaker: SKINNER
line: General, sir, stop the car!

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: What's going on here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We need you to get out of the car, sir, for your own safety.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: Why?

speaker: SKINNER
line: We just received information your life might be in danger.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: From who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Shooter! Get down!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where? Where is he?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was there! I saw him, I... It was him, sir! It was the man in the photo!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Are you sure?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I saw him, sir. It was him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Are you sure?

speaker: HONOR GUARD LEADER
line: Right, mount!

speaker: SKINNER
line: ... when you find out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully. I heard what happened. They told me you saved General Bloch's life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's doing all right. He's over there.

speaker: MULDER
line: They told me you saw somebody on the parade route.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not really sure.

speaker: MULDER
line: You saw him, didn't you? You saw Teager.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I told you. I'm not sure, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but you drew your gun, Scully. You must have been a little more convinced than that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How are you so convinced that General Bloch was his next target?

speaker: MULDER
line: I found out about General Bloch from the same person who told me that we were never meant to save Bloch's life... or the other generals.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: This case - why do you think it was dumped in your lap, unless heading up an anti-terrorism detail is all of a sudden part of your job description.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that doesn't prove that he was set up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, they knew about Teager. They'd known that he'd be unstoppable from the beginning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're saying they wanted Skinner to fail?

speaker: MULDER
line: And us. Given the nature of the case, they knew that you'd bring us in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the government is not about to sacrifice the lives of ranking military officers just to discredit us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Discrediting us in this case is only secondary.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Secondary to what?

speaker: MULDER
line: To maintaining their secret policy of denial about POW's, which required silencing the men who made that policy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think Denny Markham's story is having its intended effect. I think you're buying into the lie, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, Denny Markham may be the only man in this case who's telling the truth. But if you don't believe me, why don't you ask General Bloch himself.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: Ask me what? Look, I can't wait around here any longer. I'm delivering the keynote address in five minutes.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You might want to reconsider.

speaker: MULDER
line: He won't reconsider. Not going out there would be an admission of guilt.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We still have reason to believe that your life is in danger.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: It's your job to protect me still, isn't it?

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's what we're trying to do.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: Then do your job.

speaker: SKINNER
line: General...

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right, people, listen up because we don't have much time here. You all know your responsibilities. You have your sectors and your assignments.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: It's a great pleasure to introduce a very special man, wounded and decorated for gallantry in Vietnam, he had an idea...

speaker: DANZINGER
line: Teager?

speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: ... a vision, to create a national memorial inscribed with...

speaker: DANZINGER
line: Hey man, is that you?

speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: ... the names of all Americans who gave their lives in the Vietnam war.

speaker: DANZINGER
line: Hey, where are you going?

speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: ... Ladies and gentlemen...

speaker: DANZINGER
line: Hey!

speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: ... it is with great pride...

speaker: DANZINGER
line: Hey! Hey, where are you going?

speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: ... that I introduce the founder of the Vietnam Veteran Memorial Fund - Mr. Jan Scruggs.

speaker: DANZINGER
line: Teager?

speaker: SCRUGGS
line: Welcome, ladies and gentlemen. We are here to rededicate this memorial on this important day. We especially respectfully remember those who cannot share this day with us, the soldiers, the airmen...

speaker: DANZINGER
line: Hey, Teager?

speaker: SCRUGGS
line: ... and the sailors who remain missing in action from America's longest war. We are gathered here to remember times of war, yet pray for times of peace...

speaker: DANZINGER
line: It's me, Leo Danzinger. I saw you, man. Where are you?

speaker: TEAGER
line: Behind you.

speaker: DANZINGER
line: I, I thought you were dead. That's what they told us.

speaker: TEAGER
line: Because that's what they wanted you to believe.

speaker: DANZINGER
line: I don't understand.

speaker: TEAGER
line: You will... after tonight.

speaker: DANZINGER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: TEAGER
line: I waited for them, Leo. I waited for them to come. But they never came.

speaker: DANZINGER
line: Maybe they didn't know.

speaker: TEAGER
line: They knew. They just figured letting me die off was easier than admitting the truth.

speaker: DANZINGER
line: It's all over, Teager. It's been over for a long time now.

speaker: TEAGER
line: Not for me. Not for the others.

speaker: DANZINGER
line: You're telling me there's more?

speaker: DANZINGER
line: What are you doing, man? Where are you?

speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: It is a distinct honor to present to you now another great American, and a brother in arms. Major General Benjamin Bloch.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: Admiral Leitch. Senator Bain. Fellow Americans. And especially, the veterans.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: There is probably no audience that understands better that our freedom is not free...

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right, you're my eyes out there. Talk to me. Positions report.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... We owe that freedom to the selfless sacrifice...

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: Sector three clear.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... of those whose names...

speaker: SCULLY
line: No sign of him in four.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... are on this wall. And for that, it is our duty to remember them...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hold on. I think I have him in section four.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can you confirm that, Scully.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... their sweat, their long hours, their own blood. And for that...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Positive ID. He's heading toward you, three.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Positions hold, three and four. Do you have eye contact?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... and not too far from here, there is a statue of a solider...

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: I have him in three. He's coming toward you, Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't take your eyes off him, Scully.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... and the plaque on that statue reads "not for themselves but for their country"...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he saw me. He's heading towards the sound booth.

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: Copy that. I'm cutting him off.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Talk to me, people. Does anybody have him?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... when they were in Vietnam This memorial is a place...

speaker: SKINNER
line: What's happening, Scully?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... where we can come and thank those...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm closing on him.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... men and women who died...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do you have him in three?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... not for themselves but...

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: Negative.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... for their country.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully? Scully?

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... I'm always struck by something as I walk this mall...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I lost him. You got him, three?

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: I don't see him, Scully.

speaker: GEN. BLOCH
line: ... The Vietnam Memorial...

speaker: SKINNER
line: What's happening, Agent Scully?

speaker: AGENT HILL
line: I can't see him anywhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He must be headed your way. You got him, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not yet. I got him. I lost him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Pick him up, Mulder. He's right in front of you.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's got a gun.

speaker: SKINNER
line: General, get off the stage!

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't see him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Teager's here. I saw him out of the corner of my eye.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he's gone. He's gone.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: There's no cause for alarm, ladies and gentlemen. Just a minor disturbance. Let's try and keep some order.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's General Bloch?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's with Skinner.

speaker: MULDER
line: We've got to stop him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's going on here, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: He can only hide himself in somebody's direct line of sight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When you're looking directly at him?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's why he killed General MacDougal and Steffan at close quarters - MacDougal in his car and Steffan in his office.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get away from the car! He's in the car! Teager's in the car!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Get down! Down!

speaker: MULDER
line: Get out of the car with your hands in the air! It's over, Teager. Come on out.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Get an ambulance over here!

speaker: TEAGER
line: Teager, Nathaniel J. Sergeant, Green Beret detachment Nathaniel J. Sergeant, Green Beret detachment B-11. Service

speaker: MULDER
line: The Pentagon is claiming that the man who was killed was a Thomas Lynch. He's a vet who's been in and out of VA psychiatric hospitals for the last 15 years.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And a sometime member of The Right Hand. His name was on Denny Markham's mailing list. Markham made a positive ID.

speaker: MULDER
line: They must have gotten to him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Army forensics claims to have multiple confirmation.

speaker: MULDER
line: You heard him! We both did! It's happening all over again. They're covering the lies with more lies, trying to make him invisible. We've got to subpoena Markham and General Bloch, and we've got to petition the State Department to release Teager's body...

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can't do that, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not?

speaker: SKINNER
line: This investigation has been turned over to C.I.D. It's no longer our jurisdiction.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't let them do this.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let it go, Agent Mulder. You did your job.

speaker: MULDER
line: So did Nathaniel Teager.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You found the man you were looking for, but now he's dead. It's over.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that what you believe? Is that what you really believe? They're not just denying this man's life, they're denying his death. And with all due respect, Sir... he could be you.
